text: Russell Alberto Bufalino (October 29, 1903 – February 25, 1994) also known as "McGee" and "The Old Man", was a Sicilian-born American mobster. He was born in Sicily, Italy. He became the boss of the Northeastern Pennsylvania crime family known as the Bufalino crime family. He was leader of the organization from 1959 to 1989. Bufalino died of a heart attack on February 25, 1994 in Kingston, Pennsylvania, aged 90. ==Other websites== * "The American 'Mafia'—Who Was Who: Rosario 'Russell' Bufalino" * The Irishman and the Quiet Don by Mike La Sorte, Professor Emeritus * The New York Times: "2 Accused of a Plot to Murder Witness" Category:1903 births Category:1994 deaths Category:People from Sicily Category:American mobsters Category:Criminals from Pennsylvania
